item.title: CS 220
item.description: Self-paced course taken summer ‘22, linked here. Introductory data science programming using Python – teaches Python basics, programming fundamentals, and data science modules in Python.

item.title: CS 544
item.description: resources & deployment intro Big 3 categories of software: Analysis code – running Python code once on some data to get results Application – continuously running the code, like a website Systems – how to manage resources such as storage space Systems resources: compute -> CPU, GPU CPUs can each have multiple cores, which can be independently executing “core code” (machine code) More cores means that more tasks can be run simultaneously High level code -> compiled to bytecode -> ran by a VM -> VM is running on a core GPU has many cores that are coordinated and slow because they have to run together Cost measurement: FLOPS (floating-point operations per second) mem -> RAM RAM stores bits Small, volatile (lost upon reboot) and fast storage -> HDD, SSD Data read/written in blocks of many bytes/blocks Large, nonvolatile, slow How fast can be read/write data?

item.title: CS 61A
item.description: Self-paced course taken summer ‘22, linked here. Beginner programming course using Python – teaches data abstraction, … Great focus on shortcuts and problem-solving with code; has hints of competitive coding strategies.

item.title: Ubuntu 22.04 with UTM
item.description: No easy way to dual boot with the M1 chips – UTM is a software specifically for macOS to run VMs or emulate other machines How to create a new Ubuntu VM: Install the 22.
